verses.verse: Israel <WH3478> is a luxuriant<WH1238> vine<WH1612>, that putteth forth<WH7737> his fruit<WH6529>: according to the abundance<WH7230> of his fruit<WH6529> he hath multiplied<WH7235> his altars<WH4196>; according to the goodness<WH2896> of their land<WH776> they have made goodly<WH2895> pillars<WH4676>.
Their heart<WH3820> is divided<WH2505>; now shall they be found guilty<WH816>: he will smite<WH6202> their altars<WH4196>, he will destroy<WH7703> their pillars<WH4676>.
Surely now shall they say<WH559>, We have no king<WH4428>; for we fear<WH3372> not Jehovah<WH3068>; and the king<WH4428>, what can he do for us<WH6213>?

They speak<WH1696> vain words<WH1697>, swearing<WH422> falsely<WH7723> in making<WH3772> covenants<WH1285>: therefore judgment<WH4941> springeth up<WH6524> as hemlock<WH7219> in the furrows<WH8525> of the field<WH7704>.

The inhabitants<WH7934> of Samaria<WH8111> shall be in terror<WH1481> for the calves<WH5697> of Beth-aven<WH1007>; for the people<WH5971> thereof shall mourn<WH56> over it<WH3649>, and the priests thereof that rejoiced<WH1523> over it<WH3519>, for the glory thereof<WH1540>, because it is departed from it.

It also shall be carried<WH2986> unto Assyria<WH804> for a present<WH4503> to king<WH4428> Jareb<WH3377>: Ephraim<WH669> shall receive<WH3947> shame<WH1317>, and Israel<WH3478> shall be ashamed<WH954> of his own counsel<WH6098>.
As for Samaria<WH8111>, her king<WH4428> is cut off<WH1820>, as foam<WH7110> upon<WH6440> the water<WH4325>.

The high places<WH1116> also of Aven<WH206>, the sin<WH2403> of Israel<WH3478>, shall be destroyed<WH8045>: the thorn<WH6975> and the thistle<WH1863> shall come up<WH5927> on their altars<WH4196>; and they shall say<WH559> to the mountains<WH2022>, Cover<WH3680> us<WH1389>; and to the hills, Fall on us<WH5307>.

O Israel<WH3478>, thou hast sinned<WH2398> from the days<WH3117> of Gibeah<WH1390>: there they stood<WH5975>; the battle<WH4421> against the children<WH1121> of iniquity<WH5932> doth not overtake<WH5381> them in Gibeah<WH1390>.
When it is my desire<WH185>, I will chastise<WH3256> them<WH5971>; and the peoples shall be gathered<WH622> against them<WH631>, when they are bound to their two<WH8147> transgressions<WH5869>.

And Ephraim<WH669> is a heifer<WH5697> that is taught<WH3925>, that loveth<WH157> to tread out<WH1758> the grain<WH5674>; but I have passed over upon her fair<WH2898> neck<WH6677>: I will set a rider<WH7392> on Ephraim<WH669>; Judah<WH3063> shall plow<WH2790>, Jacob<WH3290> shall break his clods<WH7702>.

Sow <WH2232> to yourselves in<WH6310> righteousness<WH6666>, reap<WH7114> according to kindness<WH2617>; break up<WH5214> your fallow ground<WH5215>; for it is time<WH6256> to seek<WH1875> Jehovah<WH3068>, till he come<WH935> and rain<WH3384> righteousness upon you<WH6664>.

Ye have plowed<WH2790> wickedness<WH7562>, ye have reaped<WH7114> iniquity<WH5766>; ye have eaten<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> of lies<WH3585>; for thou didst trust<WH982> in thy way<WH1870>, in the multitude<WH7230> of thy mighty men<WH1368>.

Therefore shall a tumult<WH7588> arise<WH6965> among thy people<WH5971>, and all thy fortresses<WH4013> shall be destroyed<WH7703>, as Shalman<WH8020> destroyed<WH7701> Beth-arbel<WH1009> in the day<WH3117> of battle<WH4421>: the mother<WH517> was dashed in pieces<WH7376> with her children<WH1121>.

So <WH3602> shall Beth-el<WH1008> do<WH6213> unto you because<WH6440> of your great<WH7451> wickedness<WH7451>: at daybreak<WH7837> shall the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> be utterly<WH1820> cut off<WH1820>.
